awd_titl_txt: Reversible Immobilization of Enzymes and Bioligands Using   Metal-Chelate Affinity Interactions
awd_abstract_narration: 9309326  Guzman  The objective of this research is to  study and explore alternative  applications of metal chelate  interactions, and to develop  reversible and specific protein  separation methods.  Enzymes and  inhibitors (bioligands) are to be  coupled to soluble bifunctional  polymers previously modified with a  chelating compound at one of the  ends.  These modified  chelating-polymer-bioligands will  then be reversibly attached to a  previously fixed metal in a solid or  soluble support.  This approach will  allow the bioligands to be replaced  whenever their activity is lost by  simply removing the metal ion (and  subsequently the  chelate-polymer-bioligand) from the  system, leaving the initial chelate  matrix intact.  With this approach,  enzymes and specific inhibitors  bearing a chelating ligand for the  fixed metal can be attached in a  reversible manner.   ***
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
